CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 5, 1955, pg. 1, reads: "Loendi Buys Property - The first step of Pittsburgh's famous Loendi Club to move to a new location and to build new quarters was accomplished last Friday when the club purchased two acres of land near Elba Street. The business transaction took place at the Berger Building where Dr. C. C. Blow, club president (second from left), received the property deeds from William Edwin Musgrave (third from left), the former owner of the property.  Those shown in photo are (left to right) John G. Saul, of the Lawyers Title Association; Dr. Blow, Mr. Musgrave, N. Paul Jones of the real estate department; Stanley McDWilliams [sic], Loendi Club treasurer; Atty. Wendell Stanton, the club's legal counsel, and Roland M. Sawyer, chairman of Loendi's building committee. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of seven men, including John G. Saul, Dr. C. C. Blow, William Edwin Musgrave, N. Paul Jones, Stanley McWilliams, Atty. Wendell Stanton, and Roland M. Sawyer, conducting meeting in Berger Building, to purchase land for new Loendi Club, another version
